physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr W exhibited bradycardia and hypotension upon transfer to the intensive care unit.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mr W's level of alertness was fluctuating for several days following his surgery, but he was able to participate in physical therapy by postoperative day 4.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Escalating pain in the left hip requiring morphine intravenously and oxycodone orally.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Pain escalated postoperatively, requiring increased analgesic intervention.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr W was diagnosed with trochanteric bursitis due to severe pain over the left greater trochanter. Treated with an injection of triamcinolone.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Pain quickly abated after treatment with an injection.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr W was walking well with his 4-wheel walker and had minimal hip pain.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mr W regained mobility level comparable to prefracture status, indicating significant recovery.
